[us] has no special intimacy needs.
[us] wonders how long it has been since they touched anyone, really. They've been going to bed alone and waking up wanting. If nothing changes, this can only get worse, right?

[us] wants to feel wanted. It seems like everyone else has a special someone, but not them.

They're getting desperate for the faintest touch of warm skin, for momentary smoldering eyes or flirtatious words directed their way.

"Dry spell" would be putting it lightly. [us] burns with a persistent gnawing need and constant envy.

They assume everyone else's laugh and smile is laced with a romantic satisfaction that eludes them. Others hold hands, share drinks, fix the life support together.

[us] feels doomed to be alone forever.
[us] is adorned with at least one amorous or suggestive figure.
